relation: Defines the video capabilities needed for video endpoints.
Assigns a video codec to a VoIP dial peer.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS Voice Command Reference - T through Z - vad (dial peer) through voice-class sip encap clear-channel [Support] - Cisco

The default value of 100 was decreased to 60 ms., 590=Use thiscommand to set the playout jitter buffer. When a voice band is detected, the call uses the G.711 codec, and the playout delay values that you set are picked up. The original voice-call parameters are restored after the fax or modem call is completed. The no-timestamps keyword sets the jitter buffer at a constant delay without reading time stamps., 4365=Sets the nominal playout buffer delay, in ms. Range:10 to 1000. Default: 60., 6642=Sets the maximum playout buffer delay, in milliseconds (ms). Range: 40 to 1000. Default: 1000.}

Those DSP resources are then available to process voice traffic on a different network module or voice/WAN interface card (VWIC). textBeforeTable: Syntax Description [aggressive] vad no [aggressive] vad To enable voice activity detection (VAD) for calls using a specific dial peer, use the vad command in dial-peer configuration mode. To disable VAD, use the no form of this command. vad (dial peer) voice-class sip encap clear-channel voice-class sip early-media update block voice-class sip e911 voice-class sip copy-list voice-class sip calltype-video voice-class sip call-route voice-class sip block voice-class sip bind voice-class sip authenticate redirecting-number voice-class sip asymmetric payload voice-class sip associate registered-number voice-class sip asserted-id voice pcm capture voice-class sip anat voice-class permanent (voice-port) voice-class permanent (dial-peer) voice-class h323 (dial peer) voice-class codec (dial peer) voice-class called-number-pool voice-class called-number (dial peer) voice-class aaa (dial peer) voice class uri sip preference voice class uri voice class tone-signal voice class sip-profiles voice class sip-hdr-passthrulist voice class sip-copylist voice class route-string voice class resource-group
textAfterTable: Command Modes Dial-peer configuration Command History Release Modification 11.3(1)T This command was introduced on the Cisco 3600 series. 12.0(4)T This command was implemented as a dial-peer command on Cisco MC3810 (in prior releases, the vadcommand was available only as a voice-port command). 12.2(11)T The aggressive keyword was added. Usage Guidelines Use thiscommand to enable voice activity detection. With VAD, voice data packets fall into three categories: speech, silence, and unknown. Speech and unknown packets are sent over the network; silence packets are discarded. The sound quality is slightly degraded with VAD, but the connection monopolizes much less bandwidth. If you use the no form of this command, VAD is disabled and voice data is continuously sent to the IP backbone. When configuring voice gateways to handle fax calls, VAD should be disabled
